summary: The National Nuclear Security Administration manages programs related to securing and processing uranium, plutonium, tritium, and lithium—materials critical to national security. NNSA will spend an estimated $7.7 billion to manage these programs over the next 5 years. NNSA has set program requirements (such as developing cost and schedule estimates) for these programs but hasn't fully met them, due primarily to staff shortages. We recommended that...
title: Nuclear Weapons: NNSA Needs to Determine Critical Skills and Competencies for Its Strategic Materials Programs
